required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Modifications in the Anaerob Threshold in Cyclists by Consuming Docosahexaenoic Acid (DHA)
clinical_study.official_title: Modifications in the Anaerob Threshold in Cyclists (DHA)

lead_sponsor.agency: Universidad Católica San Antonio de Murcia

clinical_study.source: Universidad Católica San Antonio de Murcia

brief_summary.textblock: In a double-blind, parallel randomized clinical trial with 38 cyclists in whom the performance improvement was determined after the consumption of docosahexaenoic acid for one month.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: The change was evaluated after one month of product consumption.
primary_outcome.description: It was done with a bicycle with electromagnetic resistance (Spin Trainer ;Technogym). Heart rate was measured in beats per minute.

primary_outcome.time_frame: The change was evaluated after one month of consumption of the product
primary_outcome.description: It was done with a bicycle with electromagnetic resistance (Spin Trainer ;Technogym).It was measured in milliliters per minute

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The change was evaluated after one month of consumption of the product
secondary_outcome.description: It was done with a bicycle with electromagnetic resistance (Spin Trainer ;Technogym). Through the oxycon pro jaeger gas analyzer.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: The change was evaluated after one month of consumption of the product
secondary_outcome.description: It was done with a bicycle with electromagnetic resistance (Spin Trainer ;Technogym). Through the oxycon pro jaeger gas analyzer.

secondary_outcome.measure: blood variables: Natremia, potassium, chloremia, calcemia, , bicarbononatemia, ph, lactacidemia.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: The change was evaluated after one month of product consumption.
secondary_outcome.description: The following variables were analyzed: The variables are analyzed using the ABL 77 radiometer. The unit of measurement is mmol / L.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male between 18 and 75 years old.
- Cyclists who train three or four times a week.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Suffering some type of chronic disease.
- Consume habitually pharmacological treatments that could influence the physiological or biochemical responses to be analyzed in the present work.
- Consumption in the month prior to the start of the study, or during the performance of the same, functional food enriched with omega-3 fatty acids.
- To present during the performance of the stress tests, any of the absolute or relative contraindications dictated by the American College of Sports Medicine (ACSM, 1999) 15 would be duly informed and excluded from the present study.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Universidad Católica San Antonio de Murcia
